content: All files and folders in the {{sectionName}} section of this contact will be <1>permanently deleted in 30 days</1>.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a notification about permanent data deletion in a 30-day period. It is typically displayed in a dialog window where users can modify their contact information. Translators should provide a message indicating that all files and folders within a specific section will be permanently deleted after 30 days.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>` are not properly rendered in the Arabic translation. They appear as plain text.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure the HTML tags are correctly rendered as intended within the Arabic text. Consider using appropriate Arabic text formatting or escaping the tags if they are not intended to be interpreted as HTML.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent. The English uses <1> and </1> while the Azerbaijani uses <1> and </1>. This should be consistent.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change the closing tag in the Azerbaijani translation to </1> to match the English.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets `<1>` and `</1>` are present in both the source and target text, indicating a formatting artifact. These should be removed unless they serve a specific purpose in the user interface.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the angle brackets in the German translation: 'Alle Dateien und Ordner im Abschnitt {{sectionName}} dieses Kontakts werden dauerhaft in 30 Tagen gelöscht.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` and `</1>` tags are not correctly balanced in the Greek translation. They should be `<1>` and `</1>` to match the English.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure the start and end tags match exactly: `<1>` and `</1>`.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent with the English version. The opening tag contains '1', while the closing tag does not.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent HTML tag formatting across both languages.  For example, change </1> to </1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent with the original English.  The original uses <1> and </1> while the French uses <1> and </1>. This may impact rendering.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent HTML tag usage. Use <1> and </1> to match the original.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags `<1>` are present in both the source and translation, indicating a potential formatting requirement. Verify if these tags are necessary and intended to be preserved.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Confirm if the `<1>` tags are required and if their placement is consistent with the original intent. Consider removing them if they are not needed.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` and `</1>` tags are not correctly mirrored in the Japanese translation. The opening tag is present, but the closing tag is missing a closing bracket: </1> should be </1>
The HTML tags <1> and </1> are present in both the English and Lao translations, indicating they should be removed for clean display.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the <1> and </1> tags from the Lao translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets <1> and </1> are present in both the source and translation, indicating a formatting tag. While technically not an error, it's important to confirm if this is intentional and should be preserved in all translations. Consider removing them if they are purely for internal processing and not part of the visible text.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review the purpose of the angle brackets and remove them if they are not intended for display.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English term 'permanently deleted' is better translated as 'apagados permanentemente' in Portuguese for a more natural flow and precision. 'Eliminados permanentemente' is technically correct, but 'apagados' is more commonly used in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Todos os ficheiros e pastas na secção {{sectionName}} deste contacto serão <1>apagados permanentemente em 30 dias</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are present in both the source and translated text, which might not be desired in the final output.  They appear to be intended to highlight a specific part of the text.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing or adjusting the HTML tags depending on the intended use of the translation. If meant to indicate emphasis, other methods might be preferred.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent with the English original and potentially unnecessary or impacting rendering.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review and potentially remove or standardize the HTML tags.  Consider whether they'll render correctly or should be removed completely.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets `<1>` and `</1>` appear to be present in both the English and Serbian translations. These are likely formatting tags and should be reviewed for proper implementation or removal based on the intended use.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review and ensure correct usage or removal of the angle brackets and their corresponding closing tag.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent in English and Ukrainian. The English uses <1> and </1> while the Ukrainian uses <1> and </1>.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent HTML tag usage. Either use <1> and </1> or <1> and </1> throughout.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are present in both the English and Vietnamese versions, indicating they likely need to be removed or adjusted depending on the rendering context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove or adjust the HTML tags <1> and </1> as appropriate for the application's rendering requirements.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English word "permanently" is translated as "permanentemente". While "permanentemente" exists in Sinhala, it's a direct transliteration from Spanish/Portuguese and sounds unnatural. A more natural translation would be something like "හිතුවමිටින්" (hita-wu-ma-tin) which implies irrevocably or without return.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: මෙම සම්බන්ධතාවයේ {{sectionName}} කොටසේ ඇති සියලුම ගොファイル සහ ෆෝල්ඩර්‌ها 30 දිනකින් <1>හිතුවමිටින් මකා දමනු ලැබේ</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'ගොファイル' is a mixture of Sinhala and Japanese. It should be 'ගොファイル' or 'ගොන්න'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: මෙම සම්බන්ධතාවයේ {{sectionName}} කොටසේ ඇති සියලුම ගොන්න සහ ෆෝල්ඩර්‌ها 30 දිනකින් <1>හිතුවමිටින් මකා දමනු ලැබේ</1>.
